intro: Aechmea racinae, commonly known as the pineapple plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup, which collects rainwater. It produces a flower spike that can bear small, white flowers and red berries. Aechmea racinae is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
